H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H7916.def: = state in which animals or objects have been made available to be of service or use to others for a limited amount of time and in return for payment

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H7602.def: = process by which humans or animals strain for breath with an open mouth, ◄ caused by exhaustion or pain

H7916.def: = state in which animals or objects have been made available to be of service or use to others for a limited amount of time and in return for payment

H6960.def: = state in which humans are confident that their longing will be fulfilled

H6467.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H5157.def: = action by which humans or deities take permanent possession of objects, humans, or property, either by inheritance or force

H3391.def: = period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon

H7723.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H4487.def: = action with which one determines or estimates the number of a collection of persons, objects, or events

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H7901.def: = state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H4970.def: = reference to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive

H6153.def: = the time of day when the sun starts going down, when people leave their work and go home, have food, and go to sleep; this is also the time of the evening sacrifice, and the time when an unclean person who has gone through the cleansing rituals is declared clean, when fasting and mourning come to an end, and when the exposed body of an executed person needs to be removed

H4058.def: = action by which humans or deities ascertain the size or quantity of something by comparing it with a standard unit or with an object of known size

H7646.def: = process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

H5076.def: = action by which humans move from side to side or back and forth

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H5399.def: = the time of day before the sun comes up and after the sun goes down

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H3847.def: = state in which humans wear certain clothes, often for a specific purpose

H7415.def: = small, soft, legless, tube-shaped creatures that have no bones or shells; they typically feed on overripe fruit, rotting meat, and similar things; most are larvae that hatch from the eggs laid by flies or some beetles; associated with uncleanness, mortality, decay, and death

H1487.def: = a compact mass, usually of indefinite size and shape

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H5785.def: = the thin layer of tissue forming the natural outer covering of the body of a person or animal

H7280.def: literally: until I will wink; hence: = state in which an event lasts for a very short length of time

H3988.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

2.gl: to be clothed > to be covered

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H7043.def: = state in which animals and objects have the ability to move or act with speed ◄ due to lack of weight, agility, strength, training, or energy

H708.def: = small object with two pointed ends; ◄ part of weaving equipment; ► moves the thread of the weft across between threads of the warp; ≈ associated with swiftness

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H7210.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H7789.def: = action by which humans move from one place to another

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H6051.def: = a visible collection of condensed water vapor hanging in the atmosphere, often high above the ground ≈ also used to represent God's presence and activity

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H7585.def: = abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H4725.def: = a specific area or point in space

H5234.def: = process by which humans understand the identity or nature of (other) humans, objects or events

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H2820.def: = causative action by which human or deities keep something to themselves, refusing to give it to someone else

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H7878.def: = action by which humans produce inarticulate sounds expressing distress

H4751.def: = a small quantity of a liquid

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H8577.def: = mythical sea monster, such as {L:behemoth<SDBH:בְּהֵמֹות>} and {L:leviathan<SDBH:לִוְיָתָן>}

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H4929.def: = state in which people are constantly watched and cannot move about freely

14.gl: to place (in a position) > to appoint

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H6210.def: = a low platform standing on four legs, a bit longer than the length of a man, and about 70-80 centimeters wide

H5162.def: = causative action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear

H4904.def: = state in which humans are lying down to rest

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H2865.def: = state in which the surface of the soil is broken into many pieces

H2472.def: = process by which humans perceive a series of pictures and events in their minds; ≈ often regarded as a revelation from God; sometimes associated with things that disappear in a moment

H1204.def: = causative process by which a creature or object causes someone else to be in deep distress

H2384.def: = process by which humans see something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H977.def: = action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events

H4267.def: = process by which humans are being killed by someone else ◄ by having their air supply cut off

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H6106.def: = any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

H3988.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

H2421.def: = process by which humans are alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H2308.def: = process by which objects stop existing in this world

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H1892.def: = a slight movement of air; ≈ associated with something without substance, that quickly passes away

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H1431.def: = process by which objects increase in size

H7896.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H6485.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe a person, group, or object ► with the purpose of determining their well-being, condition, and/or integrity

H1242.def: = first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

H974.def: = action by which humans or deities examine the character of other humans or deities by having them engage in a certain activity, ◄ as a goldsmith tests the quality of a precious metal by smelting it in the fire

H7281.def: = a very short length of time

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H1104.def: = action by which humans or animals cause food to pass down from their mouth to their esophagus; ≈ often used figuratively to denote destruction and death

H7536.def: = a watery liquid in the mouth, helping with chewing and swallowing; ≈ sometimes spit out in the direction of other people as an expression of disgust

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H6466.def: = action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen

H5341.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H4853.def: literally: lifting up (one's) self; hence: = action by which humans turn to (other) humans with the confidence that they will find joy and comfort there

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H6588.def: = action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H7901.def: = state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H7836.def: = process by which the color of an object turns darker until it is (almost) black

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant
